page.title: 15HOUSING IN BUCHLYVIE
page.content: Almost half the dwellings throughout the village were built by the{local {authority}about 30 years ago. There are flats and semi-detached houses. Both within and outside the village, the{privately-owned houses}show more variety, and may be up to 250 years old. Several are of selected red sandstone, others are of mixed stones found in the fields. Most roofs are of slate. Many walls are harled or painted white.{A new development}of 26 houses and bungalows was built 7 years ago.These vary in size, but the planning authorities decreed their harled brick walls and tiled roofs. A{typical house}has a garden, views of the hills, a downstairs kitchen, lounge and dining room, and upstairs a bathroom and 2,3 or 4 bedrooms. {Common luxuries}are a study, utility room, shower, and downstairs lavatory.
